icontrol.drivers.instruments.eurotherm

Class EurothermTC

  • java.lang.Object
    • icontrol.drivers.Device
      • icontrol.drivers.instruments.eurotherm.EurothermTC

  • @iC_Annotation(CommPorts=RS232,
               InstrumentClassName="Eurotherm TC")
public class EurothermTC
extends Device
    Eurotherm Temperature Controller. This class was tailored for a Eurotherm 3200 controller but might also serve as base class for other models.

    To set parameters in the Eurotherm controller, use WriteA32bitValue, which is implemented in this class.

    All device commands that the EurothermTC understands are implemented here.

    Instrument Commands:

    • getProcessValue()
    • setModbusAddress(int)
    • setRampRate(float, int)
    • setSP1(float)
    • ReadA32bitValue(short, Class)
    • WriteA32bitValue(short, Number)
    The following is an excerpt of a log of iTools when changing SetPoint1: 
    log from iTools OPC Server, Network Monitor ON, COM1 Statistics
enable Monitor, log to file, \Local Settings\Temp\EuroMBus.log

           Adr = 1 (okay)
           | Fct code 10 = Write N words
           | |  Adr of first word (80 30 = 0x8000 + 2*24; adr 24=Setpoint1)
           | |  |     Write 2 words
           | |  |     |     Nr data bytes
           | |  |     |     |  Data (I set SP1 to 0)
           | |  |     |     |              CRC
29:TX-OK: 01 10 80 30 00 02 04 00 00 00 00 91 7D
29:RX-OK: 01 10 80 30 00 02 68 07

             Fct code 3 = Read N bytes
             |  Adr of first word
             |  |     Nr of words to read
             |  |     |     CRC
2A:TX-OK: 01 03 80 30 00 02 ED C4
2A:RX-OK: 01 03 04 00 00 00 00 FA 33
         
                read Instrument Mode (register 199)
2B:TX-OK: 01 03 81 8E 00 02 8C 1C
2B:RX-OK: 01 03 04 00 01 80 00 CA 33
         
                read register 16128 (it's not listed in the manual)
2C:TX-OK: 01 03 3F 00 00 0F 09 DA
2C:RX-OK: 01 03 1E 00 20 20 32 B5 33 80 12 00 20 80 12 00 00 00 00 FF 03 00 09 02 FF 00 01 01 11 00 00 00 A0 1A D7

                               change SP1 to 12.34 as IEEE float
3E:TX-OK: 01 10 80 30 00 02 04 41 45 70 A4 B0 EF
3E:RX-OK: 01 10 80 30 00 02 68 07
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    KPP (Kurt Pernstich: pernstich@alumni.ethz.ch)

    • Method Detail

      • Open

        public void Open()
        Calculates and stores the time signaling the end-of-transmission (3.5 bytes). Note that experiments on a slow computer indicated that it is wise to wait longer than 3.5 bytes; currently it's set to 3 times that (12 instead of 4 ms) although 2 times might also work.

        Overridden Device.Open for additional initializations after establishing the connection to the Instrument. This method is not called when in Syntax-Check mode or when in No-Communication mode! For these cases, the wait time is set in the definition of the local variables.

        Overrides:
        Open in class Device

      • setModbusAddress

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="Sets the MODBUS address of the controller.",
                   ParameterNames="Modbus address { [1, 254] }",
                   DefaultValues="1",
                   ToolTips="")
public void setModbusAddress(int ModbusAdr)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 throws java.util.zip.DataFormatException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        java.io.IOException
        Changes the Modbus address for the Eurotherm controller. The default Modbus address can be set in the iC.properties. This method also calls checkLoopback depending on the switch EurothermTC.CheckLoopBack in iC.properties.

        Parameters:
        ModbusAdr - The new Modbus address; can be 1-254 and the value is cast to a byte.
        Throws:
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - when the Syntax Check failed.
        java.io.IOException - Bubbles up from checkLoopback

      • setSP1

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Sets the SetPoint 1 temperature.</html>",
                   ParameterNames="T [displayed units]",
                   DefaultValues="20",
                   ToolTips="")
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=false)
public void setSP1(float SetPoint)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             throws java.io.IOException
        Changes the SetPoint SP1 (Register address 24).

        Note from the manual: Do not write continuously changing values to this variable. The memory technology used in this product has a limited (100,000) number of write cycles. If ramped setpoints are required, consider using the internal ramp rate function or the remote comms setpoint (Modbus address 26) in preference.

        Parameters:
        SetPoint - The new temperature setpoint. The unit is in display units.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the transmission via RS232 caused an error; bubbles up from WriteA32bitValue.

      • setRampRate

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Sets the RampRate 1.</html>",
                   ParameterNames={"Ramp Rate [TimeBase]","Time Base {0, 1, 2}"},
                   DefaultValues={"6","0"},
                   ToolTips={"","<html>Time Base for the Ramp Rate. Can be<br>0 ... Ramp per Minute<br>1 ... Ramp per Hour<br>2 ... Ramp per Second</html>"})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=false)
public void setRampRate(float RampRate,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         int TimeBase)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Changes the Ramp Rate (SP.RAT, setpoint rate limit, address 35) and also the unit of the rampe rate (RAMPU, ramp units, address 531).

        Parameters:
        RampRate - The new Ramp Rate in units of the TimeBase.
        TimeBase - The TimeBase: 0 for ramping in Seconds, 1 for Hours and 2 for ramping in Seconds
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the transmission via RS232 caused an error; bubbles up from WriteA32bitValue.

      • checkLoopback

        private void checkLoopback()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Checks for the presence of a Eurotherm controller by sending the loopback command to a receiver with the specified Modbus address.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurs (bubbles up from SendViaRS232 or QueryViaRS232), or an invalid answer was received via RS232.

      • WriteA32bitValue

        public void WriteA32bitValue(short RegisterAddress,
                             java.lang.Number Value)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a Float or an Integer value as a 32bit value to the specified register address. It accesses the full resolution data (registers above 0x8000). The response of the Eurotherm is read and checked for validity.

        This method is public, so it can be called from the script, but it does not define a AutoGUIAnnotation entry, hence, it is not visible in the GUI.

        Parameters:
        RegisterAddress - is the address of the register in the Eurotherm controller that should receive Value. The register address is multiplied by two and 0x8000 is added in order to write full resolution 32 bits to the register (see chapter 7 of Modbus Communications Handbook). Therefore, the original register address as it is listed in the 3200's manual is to be specified here.
        Value - will be written to the register address. The data type of Value must be Float or Integer.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if 1) the transmission via RS232 caused an error (bubbles up from SendViaRS232 or QueryViaRS232), or 2) an invalid reply was received from the Eurotherm controller, or 3) the data type of Value is neither Float nor Integer (this should actually only occur during development.

      • ReadA32bitValue

        public java.lang.Number ReadA32bitValue(short RegisterAddress,
                                        java.lang.Class<?> ReturnType)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a Float or an Integer value as a 32bit value from the specified register address. It accesses the full resolution data (registers above 0x8000). The response of the Eurotherm is read and checked for validity.

        This method is public, so it can be called from the script, but it does not define a AutoGUIAnnotation entry, hence, it is not visible in the GUI.

        Parameters:
        RegisterAddress - is the address of the register in the Eurotherm controller from which the value should be retrieved. The register address is multiplied by two and 0x8000 is added in order to read full resolution 32 bits from the register (see chapter 7 of Modbus Communications Handbook). Therefore, the original register address as it is listed in the 3200's manual is to be specified here.
        ReturnType - Specifies the data type of the returned value. Valid data types are Float or Integer. Use for instance Float.TYPE to specify ReturnType.
        Returns:
        The value of the register in the Eurotherm controller
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if 1) the transmission via RS232 caused an error (bubbles up from SendViaRS232 or QueryViaRS232), or 2) an invalid reply was received from the Eurotherm controller, or 3) the data type of ReturnType is neither Float nor Integer (this should actually only occur during development.

      • calcCRC

        private boolean calcCRC(java.nio.ByteBuffer msg)
        Calculates the 16-bit CRC code as required by the Eurotherm controller. For a definition of the CRC code see Eurotherm's Modbus Digital Communications Handbook (chapter 3-8, pdf page 32).

        Note that the CRC is calculated over all but the last two bytes in msg. The calculated CRC is compared with the last two bytes in msg and if they agree, this method returns true, otherwise it returns false. The calculated CRC value is stored in the last two bytes of msg.

        Parameters:
        msg - The (8-bit) ByteBuffer of which the CRC should be calculated. See also the note above.
        Returns:
        True if the last two bytes of msg are equal to the calculated CRC value, and false otherwise. The calculated CRC value is stored in the last two bytes of msg.
